text: Why isn't self being automatically passed to a method that is set on an object after its instantiation?

code:
class Person():
    pass;
 def say_hi(self):
    print 'hii'

 me=Person()
 me.say_hi=say_hi
 me.say_hi()

text: Isn't the self argument automatically passed in python ?
why why is calling me.say_hi() is giving a stack trace ?

code:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<input>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: say_hi() takes exactly 1 argument (0 given)
